1: <sup>1</sup> Let God arise, let his enemies be scattered: let them also that hate him flee before him.
2: <sup>2</sup> As smoke is driven away, so drive them away: as wax melteth before the fire, so let the wicked perish at the presence of God.
3: <sup>3</sup> But let the righteous be glad; let them rejoice before God: yea, let them exceedingly rejoice.
4: <sup>4</sup> Sing unto God, sing praises to his name: extol him that rideth upon the heavens by his name JAH, and rejoice before him.
5: <sup>5</sup> A father of the fatherless, and a judge of the widows, is God in his holy habitation.
6: <sup>6</sup> God setteth the solitary in families: he bringeth out those which are bound with chains: but the rebellious dwell in a dry land.
7: <sup>7</sup> O God, when thou wentest forth before thy people, when thou didst march through the wilderness; Selah:
8: <sup>8</sup> The earth shook, the heavens also dropped at the presence of God: even Sinai itself was moved at the presence of God, the God of Israel.
9: <sup>9</sup> Thou, O God, didst send a plentiful rain, whereby thou didst confirm thine inheritance, when it was weary.
10: <sup>10</sup> Thy congregation hath dwelt therein: thou, O God, hast prepared of thy goodness for the poor.
11: <sup>11</sup> The Lord gave the word: great was the company of those that published it.
12: <sup>12</sup> Kings of armies did flee apace: and she that tarried at home divided the spoil.
13: <sup>13</sup> Though ye have lien among the pots, yet shall ye be as the wings of a dove covered with silver, and her feathers with yellow gold.
14: <sup>14</sup> When the Almighty scattered kings in it, it was white as snow in Salmon.
15: <sup>15</sup> The hill of God is as the hill of Bashan; an high hill as the hill of Bashan.
16: <sup>16</sup> Why leap ye, ye high hills? this is the hill which God desireth to dwell in; yea, the LORD will dwell in it for ever.
17: <sup>17</sup> The chariots of God are twenty thousand, even thousands of angels: the Lord is among them, as in Sinai, in the holy place.
18: <sup>18</sup> Thou hast ascended on high, thou hast led captivity captive: thou hast received gifts for men; yea, for the rebellious also, that the LORD God might dwell among them.
19: <sup>19</sup> Blessed be the Lord, who daily loadeth us with benefits, even the God of our salvation. Selah.
20: <sup>20</sup> He that is our God is the God of salvation; and unto GOD the Lord belong the issues from death.
21: <sup>21</sup> But God shall wound the head of his enemies, and the hairy scalp of such an one as goeth on still in his trespasses.
22: <sup>22</sup> The Lord said, I will bring again from Bashan, I will bring my people again from the depths of the sea:
23: <sup>23</sup> That thy foot may be dipped in the blood of thine enemies, and the tongue of thy dogs in the same.
24: <sup>24</sup> They have seen thy goings, O God; even the goings of my God, my King, in the sanctuary.
25: <sup>25</sup> The singers went before, the players on instruments followed after; among them were the damsels playing with timbrels.
26: <sup>26</sup> Bless ye God in the congregations, even the Lord, from the fountain of Israel.
27: <sup>27</sup> There is little Benjamin with their ruler, the princes of Judah and their council, the princes of Zebulun, and the princes of Naphtali.
28: <sup>28</sup> Thy God hath commanded thy strength: strengthen, O God, that which thou hast wrought for us.
29: <sup>29</sup> Because of thy temple at Jerusalem shall kings bring presents unto thee.
30: <sup>30</sup> Rebuke the company of spearmen, the multitude of the bulls, with the calves of the people, till every one submit himself with pieces of silver: scatter thou the people that delight in war.
31: <sup>31</sup> Princes shall come out of Egypt; Ethiopia shall soon stretch out her hands unto God.
32: <sup>32</sup> Sing unto God, ye kingdoms of the earth; O sing praises unto the Lord; Selah:
33: <sup>33</sup> To him that rideth upon the heavens of heavens, which were of old; lo, he doth send out his voice, and that a mighty voice.
34: <sup>34</sup> Ascribe ye strength unto God: his excellency is over Israel, and his strength is in the clouds.
35: <sup>35</sup> O God, thou art terrible out of thy holy places: the God of Israel is he that giveth strength and power unto his people. Blessed be God.
